Ninnie Wahlboirg. — FolikskoH :ex. 05, slud:-ex. 09, fil. kand. i Upps. 11, ämneslär. 11-16, rektor v. Vendelsbergs folkhögskola fr. 28, rekt. v. Karlskoga fodkhögsk. 16-28, v. Vendelsbergs folkhögsk. ’sed. 28. Ordf. i Gbgs o. Boh. 1. bildnrförb., istyr:led. i Riksteat., i Sv:. gymn :förb., rikisisitud :iled. i NTO, led :skrib. i tidn. Ariel. Skr.: Två sv. dikt. hövdingar (23), Ett bildn.- o. stud:program (32), Trädet (dikter 40), Studium, handledn. i folkl. bildn :arb. (42), Folkrör. ,stud :handbok (44).
translated: Elgeskog, Justus Ferdiinaind, Bachelor of Arts, teacher, Mölndal, born on March 21, 1884 in Vittaryd, Kronoberg County. Married for 13 months to Ninnie Wahlborg. Education: elementary school exam in 1905, student exam in 1909, Bachelor of Arts from Uppsala in 1911, subject teacher from 1911 to 1916, rector of Vendelsberg Folk High School from 1928, rector of Karlskoga Folk High School from 1916 to 1928, and back to Vendelsberg Folk High School from 1928. He is the chairman of Gothenburg and Bohus County Art Association and board member of Riksteatern, Swedish Gymnastics Association, and National Temperance Association. He is also a contributing writer for Ariel newspaper. His works include "Two Swedish Poetic Chieftains" (1923), "A Portrait and Study Program" (1932), "The Tree" (poems 1940), "Study, Instructions in Popular Artwork" (1942), and "The Handbook of Popular Movement Studies" (1944).
